First of all, this is just a fun build, a brainstrom to get the most out of a messed up idea :)

Edit:
I realized I didn't write anything about class and weapon selection... :) I mean why barb and why unarmed?
So, bioware granted us packages at character creation, every base class got 4-5 or more variants of these. I never heard anybody to recommend the use of these packages, but I thought some of the ideas might be interesting. This is one of those ideas, the savage package for the barbarian.

This is the description of the package:
The savagery of this package is remarkable even among barbarians, as he prefers to use his bare hands in melee instead of resorting to a weakling’s weapons.

I think the unarmed fight is the privilege of the monk, so I don't want to use any monk levels in the build. The lack of monk levels leaves the unarmed damage at 1d3 (for medium races, it is 1d2 for halflings and gnomes), so the most important thing is to get the strength to as high as reasonably possible and/or get WS/EWS. The second thing is, that those gloves that help the character at unarmed fight are monk only (at least in OC they are), so we need a class that has access to UMD to pierce damage resistance with those items (we don't get ki strike). That leaves me two choices, a Bb/Bard/RDD, or a Bb/Fighter/Rogue-or-Ass-or-Bard.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
You are going to need at least INT 14 in the first version.  Reason: You'll need to max both Intimidate and Taunt and probably need Expertise even with a shield. 

It would be silly not to use Terrifying Rage in any/all builds with at least 16 levels of barb.  It's just too much of an exploit to pass by.  Thundering Rage requires a weapon.  Fists are not weapons, hence the focus/impcrit named "Unarmed Strike".  But not to worry.  Thundering Rage is only a convenience which is easily eclipsed by more significant epic feats anyway.

Taunting will add another +6 to the AB in both builds.  In PvP, you'd also need to max Concentration.

Bard needs very little UMD to cast all scrolls, arcane and divine, without failure.  Just enough to cover the scroll's value, typically UMD net(modified) ranks either 10 or 15 is plenty.  Wands may be a bit more expensive than scrolls, but not all that much.

The most rogue needs to cast without spell failure is a modified level of UMD 33.  The rest is a luxury to use class-specific items that might contain several powerful properties.

In the RDD version, DevCrit at Level 24 should be the target.  Waiting until the last level pretty much defeats the purpose of making the feat a priority in the design.

Your rogue skills are way out of whack.  Rather than spending time going through the process of establishing worthwhile targets for them, please check out my guide.  Disable trap is near worthless without adequate Search to spot the traps in the first place.

The AC just isn't good enough to bypass Expertise during pre-epic and perhaps even Called Shot to increase it.  I am betting encounters with high challenge rating will become nerve-racking without a way to prevent getting spam-critted.  When you test, make sure to set up high CR mobs that can flank your position for several rounds.  That's a common situation for most melee-centric types and can become deadly with lowish AC.

edit:  It finally occurred to me that you will need Improved Unarmed Strike in both builds else suffer constant AoOs.  I've never built anything but unarmed monks, the "Cadillac" of unarmed melee classes, who get IUS for free at Level 1 so passed right over it.  Also, Blind Fight is missing from the fighter version...  a nightmare against concealed or hidden foes.

There are more changes at epic levels.
The general feats are in that order: Over Crit: Unarmed, Dev Crit: Unarmed, Terrifying Rage, Expertise, Improved Expertise, Great Strength I, Great Strength II.
The two Barbarian bonus feats are: EWF: Unarmed and Epic prowess.
There is no Armor Skin now. If I drop 1 more point from AB and damage (start STR at 19 and only one Great Strength feat) it is possible to get that too, this way CON can start at 14, and DEX or WIS at 9 or CHA at 7. OR leave STR at 20, and grab another epic general feat (Called shot? KD? It is very late for them...).

Rogue build:
Skills: in PvM the skills should be something like this: Disable Trap 1 (5), Discipline 43 (55), Intimidate 43 (41), Listen 43 (42), Set Trap 16 (15), Taunt 43 (41), Tumble 40 (39), UMD 35 (33). We have 2 unassigned point, which is not enough to make a significant change in any skill. Maybe they can go into open lock, to pick locks up to DC 21+thieves' tools.
Skills for PvP: from the three classes only the fighter has the concentration as class skill, so the last fighter level should be as late as possible... if someone wants to PvP with this, my idea here is to drop 1 level of rogue (we don't get anything useful from that 4th rogue level), and get one more fighter at 39 or 40 to max out concentration. Of course there will be an XP penalty for this, and we have to drop a full skill for that conc. Anyway, if someone wants to PvP with an unarmed char, go with a monk...
Some changes in leveling: rogue levels are at 23, 27, 32 and 37, fighters are at 21, 22, 31 and 33.
On pre-epic I dropped KD and IKD to get Expertise and Improved Expertise, on epic levels I dropped two great stregths to get Terrifying Rage and Blind Fight, the others remained the same.
I don't know if Called Shot could be put anywhere... maybe we could drop two more great strengths and get called shot and KD... or maybe with more fighter levels.

Improved Unarmed Strike:
As I mentioned earlier, IUS does not necessary as if we have equipped something in the gloves / bracers slot, AoOs will not occure. Source: http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Improved_unarmed_strike

There are approximately 250 complete and tested builds here on the Guild's pages.  They can only be searched using the Excel filter or raw data imported into your own spreadsheet utility.  There are a few thousand builds contained in the legacy archive which can still be searched on your local machine with a Javascript-enabled browser.  The one I referenced resides within the archive and, most likely, so is Mick's link.

The trainers are a good way to check that your skill allotment works in practice and to discover some obvious flaws.

Choose your favorite version and try it out a bit on either a PW or a challenging SP (HotU is pretty good for that and you can pregenerate to Lvl 15ish to speed things along).  Make any further adjustments and then post it here (ignore the spoiler toggle) for final sanitization by the members.  There are no actual crazy ideas, just some that may appear to go against the grain of optimization or rashly conceived.  Innovation is worth the effort IMO, but it's your call.  Your builds are well-formatted so that's a step in the right direction.

Your comments about the weakness(es) of a DEXer is typical.  Epic rogue sneakers will usually opt for Skill Mastery even though they may need to make a sacrifice elsewhere so they can use traps offensively to compensate. An assassin does not have that option, unfortunately.  A classic combo is BBoD/Greater Sanctuary (will not unsummon BBoD when setting traps) but relies on access to those scrolls via UMD either bought at a magic shop or from a sympathetic scriber.  Without traps, yes, they are relegated to DEX-peckers... safe but time-consuming damage.
